snippet: The left-handed Phil Mickelson needed to turn his swing around on the fourth hole at the Masters, where he shot a triple-bogey 6.

snippet: Rich foreigners have helped make real estate in central London all but inaccessible to most Brits. Can you imagine a Manhattan where even most well-off Americans couldn't afford to buy?
abstract: Rich foreigners have helped make real estate in central London all but inaccessible to most Brits. Can you imagine a Manhattan where even most well-off Americans couldn't afford to buy?

headline.main: As Russian Real Estate Money Floods in, Could New York Go the Way of London?

snippet: Although the growth in C.E.O. compensation slowed last year, the pay numbers are still eye-popping.
abstract: Growth in executive compensation has slowed in the past year, but the numbers are still eye-popping; data on CEO compensation in 2011 confirms that top executives do far better than the average worker, whether times are good or bad; pay among the 100 best-paid chief executives at large American corporations held fairly steady in 2011.

headline.main: In Executive Pay, a Rich Game of Thrones
headline.print_headline: A Rich Game of Thrones: C.E.O. Pay Gains May Have Slowed, But the Numbers Are Still Numbing

snippet: The concept at Moonshine Modern Supper Club is to create a menu and environment that strike a balance between retro dishes and cocktails and a modern sensibility.
abstract: David M Halbfinger reviews Moonshine Modern Supper Club restaurant in Millburn (Metropolitan/New Jersey).

snippet: Jean-Claude Perennou, a Frenchman, and Gnanasampanthan Sabaratnam, a Sri Lankan, opened Cannelle Patisserie in 2007, and immediately began working 14-hour days to accommodate demand.
abstract: Neighborhood Joint column on Cannelle Patisserie, bakery in East Elmhurst, Queens, with a culturally diverse staff and clientele.

headline.main: Disruptions: Too Much Silence On Working Conditions

snippet: 9:45 p.m. | Updated to reflect the version published in the print edition.     Apple's rivals are quick to say how much better, faster, cheaper or more popular their smartphones, computers and tablets are.
abstract: Nick Bilton Disruptions column; Apple has announced that it will use the Fair Labor Association independent auditor to address criticism of working conditions in overseas factories it uses to produce its products, specifically those of Foxconn; makers of other devices are less open to talk about their factories and supply chains. (M)/

headline.main: Disruptions: Too Much Silence On Working Conditions
